input.description: adapter name [Optional] The name of the adapter that is enabled on the Peer. The default adapter name is SCOMActor

This wrapper is used to find history of alerts. Alerts whose history is required are retrieved by specifying a particular search criteria.
Sample Item XML:
<items> <item> <operation-name>get-alerthistory</operation-name> <timeout-secs>120</timeout-secs> <command-parameters> <alert> <alert-search-criteria> <operator>and</operator> <criteria-expression> <key>Name</key> <value>Computer%</value> <operator>like</operator> </criteria-expression> <criteria-expression> <key>Id</key> <value>4be8166b-2444-454e-9f81-534b7508f585</value> <operator>equals</operator> </criteria-expression> </alert-search-criteria> </alert> </command-parameters> </item> </items>
Parmeters Description:
operation-name[Required] Operation that will be executed
timeout-secs[Optional] Time in seconds after which the request will time-out of not completed. Default is: 60 secs
command-parameters[Required] This is the parent tag that contains actual parameters required to execute this particular operation.
alert[Required] This is the parent tag that contains the search criteria to fetch a set of alerts. The history of these alerts then will retrieved by the wrapper.
alert-search-criteria[Required] This is the parent tag for defining the search criteria.
criteria-expression[Required] This is the parent tag which contains details that make up a single search criteria. Multiple 'criteria-expression' tags can be provided under 'alert-search-criteria'.
key[Required] This tag contains the alert attribute by which the alerts are filtered. Valid values for this tag can be any of the alert attributes such as: name, description, id etc. You can use Find Alert By ID to get the list of all the alert attributes.
value[Required] This tag contains the valid search expression for the attribute specified in the key. Please refer to Criteria guide for valid search criteria expression format. NOTE: For help on writing regular expressions refer to 'Regular Expressions Guide.doc'
operator[Required] The 'operator' tag specified under 'alert-search-criteria' tag specifies the operand between multiple 'criteria-expression' tags. Valid values - and, or
The 'operator' tag specified under 'criteria-expression specifies the operand for key and value specified. Valid values - equals, not equals, like, in, greater than,less than NOTE: 'in' operator should only be used when 'Id' is used as key

documentation.description: This wrapper is used to find history of alerts. Alerts whose history is required are retrieved by specifying a particular search criteria.
